title: Alset International First Half 2025 Earnings: S$0.003 loss per share (vs S$0.001 loss in 1H 2024)
description: Catalist:40V 1 Year Share Price vs Fair Value Explore Alset International's Fair Values from the Community and select...
content:
Explore Alset International's Fair Values from the Community and select yours
• S$0.003 loss per share (further deteriorated from S$0.001 loss in 1H 2024).

This technology could replace computers: discover the 20 stocks are working to make quantum computing a reality.

All figures shown in the chart above are for the trailing 12 month (TTM) period

Alset International shares are down 4.3% from a week ago.

We should say that we've discovered 2 warning signs for Alset International that you should be aware of before investing here.

Have feedback on this article? Concerned about the content? Get in touch with us directly. Alternatively, email editorial-team (at) simplywallst.com.



This article by Simply Wall St is general in nature. We provide commentary based on historical data and analyst forecasts only using an unbiased methodology and our articles are not intended to be financial advice. It does not constitute a recommendation to buy or sell any stock, and does not take account of your objectives, or your financial situation. We aim to bring you long-term focused analysis driven by fundamental data. Note that our analysis may not factor in the latest price-sensitive company announcements or qualitative material. Simply Wall St has no position in any stocks mentioned.
summary: Alset International shares are down 4.3% from a week ago. The company's first half 2025 earnings are expected to be at least S$0.003 per share, a decrease from the previous year's average of S$1.05.
shortSummary: Alset International shares fell over 4.3% due to declining earnings, with investors warned to expect significant losses and potential for future conflicts.

| 2009 | n/a | Ambrose Chan | www.alsetinternational.com |
Alset International Limited, an investment holding company, engages in the property development in Singapore, South Korea, Australia, and the United States. It operates through Property Development and Investment, Investment Business, Information Technology Business, Biomedical Business, and Food and Beverage segments. It develops property projects and invests in property development projects.

argos_summary: Alset International (ticker 40V) is an investment holding company that develops property projects in Singapore, South Korea, Australia and the U.S. The firm posted a trailing‑12‑month loss of S$18.1 million on revenue of S$15.6 million, with a negative gross margin of –9.8 % and a net profit margin of –115.9 %. Its share price has been highly volatile (≈10 % weekly) and has underperformed both the Singapore real‑estate sector (–12 % vs +36 %) and the broader market (–12 % vs +25 %) over the past year. Despite the losses, the company scores a perfect 6/6 for financial health and has no debt.
